Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler

Class WolfScheduler

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler.WolfScheduler
public class WolfScheduler extends Object
Adds and removes courses from students schedule based on availability in course catalog
Author:
Sachi Vyas

    • getCourseCatalog

      public String[][] getCourseCatalog()
      Makes an array with three variables given[name, section, title] if the course is present in catalog
      Returns:
      catalogArray that holds the name, section, and title of course

    • getScheduledActivities

      public String[][] getScheduledActivities()
      Returns an array off schedules course with their name, section, and title
      Returns:
      arraySchedule with the name, section, title from the schedule or else returns empty schedule

    • getFullScheduledActivities

      public String[][] getFullScheduledActivities()
      Returns an array of scheduled courses with all the needed information
      Returns:
      arraySchedule an array of scheduled courses will all the details (time, section, name, etc.)

      Get's a course from the course catalog

      section - section of course
      Returns:

    • addCourseToSchedule

      public boolean addCourseToSchedule(String name, String section)
      Adds a course to schedule
      Parameters:
      name - of the course
      section - section of course
      Returns:
      true if the course can be added, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if course to add is already in schedule

    • removeActivityFromSchedule

      public boolean removeActivityFromSchedule(int idx)
      Removes a course from schedule
      Parameters:
      idx - index from which to remove the activity from the schedule array
      Returns:
      true of the course can be removed, false otherwise

    • setScheduleTitle

      public void setScheduleTitle(String title)
      Sets the schedule title
      Parameters:
      title - title of schedule
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if title is null

    • resetSchedule

      public void resetSchedule()
      Resets the schedule i.e., removes all the courses from schedule

    • addEventToSchedule

      public void addEventToSchedule(String eventTitle, String eventMeetingDays, int eventStartTime, int eventEndTime, String eventDetails)
      Adds an event to the schedule
      Parameters:
      eventTitle - title of event
      eventMeetingDays - meeting time of event
      eventStartTime - start time of event
      eventEndTime - end time of event
      eventDetails - details about the event
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the event already exists in the schedule
